contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses|Nangō (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox Former Municipality Japan |Name= Nangō |JapaneseName=南郷村 |MapImage= Map.Nango-Vill.Aomori.PNG |Since=March 31, 2005 |Currently=[[Hachinohe, Aomori|Hachinohe]] |Region=[[Tōhoku region]] |Prefecture=[[Aomori Prefecture|Aomori]] |District= [[Sannohe District, Aomori|Sannohe District]] |Area=91.13 |PopDate=February 1, 2006 |Population=6,440 |Density=70.67 |Tree= [[Japanese Red Pine]] |Flower= [[Adonis (plant)|Far East Amur adonis]] |Bird= [[Green Pheasant]] |Coord= |CityHallLink= }} {{nihongo|'''Nangō'''|南郷村|Nangō-mura}} was a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Sannohe District, Aomori|Sannohe District]] in central [[Aomori Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. Nangō Village was founded on April 1, 1889. On March 31, 1957 it merged with the neighboring villages of Shimamori and Nakazawa. On March 31, 2005 it was [[Merger and dissolution of municipalities of Japan|merged]] into the city of [[Hachinohe, Aomori|Hachinohe]], and thus it no longer exists as an independent municipality. An inland village, Nangō had an agriculture-based economy. At the time of its merger, Nangō had an estimated [[population]] of 6,440 and a [[population density]] of 70.67 persons per km². The total area was 91.13 km². {{coord|40|24|13.40|N|141|26|14.5|E|region:JP_type:city_source:GNS-enwiki|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Nango, Aomori}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Aomori Prefecture]] {{aomori-geo-stub}}
